Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored a second-half penalty to register his first goal at a European Championship.
Robert Lewandowski equalized for Poland with a penalty after a retake due to the France goalkeeper Mike Maignan jumping from his line prematurely.
Ousmane Dembélé was fouled by Jakub Kiwior, leading to Mbappé's penalty goal.
Dayot Upamecano's challenge on Karol Swiderski resulted in a VAR-reviewed penalty for Poland.
Pre-Game Insights: France were favorites at the outset of the tournament.
France manager Didier Deschamps was described as a professor by Poland's manager Michal Probierz.
Post-Match Reflections: Deschamps had no complaints about the legitimacy of Lewandowski’s second penalty effort.
Deschamps grew irked as his side struggled to breach Poland's defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France will face the runners-up of Group E in the last 16, possibly Belgium.
Austria topped Group D, with France finishing in second place.
